comments.body: `errors` will always be an array of `{ name, message }`, right? It would be a nice enhancement to capture that, but not a blocker.

Thanks for approval 
I'll add that enhancement in the coming pr
Had to search for this prop but found it finally on CheckboxWidget. So :+1 from me for this change

Note for myself:  I haven't used `withTheme` myself, but, based on the example [here]( https://react-jsonschema-form.readthedocs.io/en/latest/theme-customization/#withtheme-higher-order-component):
- in the example, `schema` and `uiSchema` are provided to the "wrapped" component
- `uiSchema` is optional (so no need to "omit" it)

So I think this should work ðŸ‘

seems like `Omit` is not defined, at least my typescript complains:
```
Failed to compile
/project-path/node_modules/@types/react-jsonschema-form/index.d.ts
TypeScript error in /project-path/node_modules/@types/react-jsonschema-form/index.d.ts(239,39):
Cannot find name 'Omit'.  TS2304

    237 |     };
    238 | 
  > 239 |     export type ThemeProps<T = any> = Omit<FormProps<T>, 'schema'>;
        |                                       ^
    240 | 
    241 |     export function withTheme<T = any>(
    242 |         themeProps: ThemeProps<T>
```

Weird, I'm running typescript 3.5...
I only found this note (below [this example)](https://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/handbook/release-notes/typescript-2-8.html#example-4) while researching
Yes, because on Typescript 2.8, Omit isn't included. But you don't have any problem executing with Typescript 3.5.
Make sure that you are running typescript 3.5
